intro: Caucalis platycarpos subsp. echinophora, commonly known as the spiked bladderwrack, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and is typically found in coastal areas with sandy or gravelly substrates. The plant has a short, creeping stem with fleshy, inflated leaves that help it retain moisture in its saline environment. It plays an important role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for small marine organisms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
